title: Manhattan: Welfare Island - East River.

text:
(1)
Welfare Island, its western shore on the East River, as seen from Carl Schurz Park, looking southward. In the right background is visible the Queensborough Bridge.
Summer 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date.
June 24, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The eastern shore of the island, as seen from the State Barge Canal Terminal, Long Island City, looking southward.
November 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

text:
Welfare Island (center of view), looking westward from the Queens end of the Queensborough Bridge. In the foreground appears part of the shore of Long Island City, Queens, and across the island; Manhattan.

July 17, 1925.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Welfare Island.

folder: Welfare Island & New York County Penitentiary & Cell blocks., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
New York County Penitentiary; close-up of a cell, showing the forlorn aspects of an individual cell before the improvements were made.

About 1927.

(2)
The same; showing the new bars, a recent addition to the cell blocks.

About 1929.
title: Manhattan: Welfare Island - New York County Penitentiary - Cell blocks.

folder: Long Island City & Astoria & General view., Queens, NY
text:
A general view of Long Island City and Astoria, photographed north westward from over Bridge Plaza (see "El" lines at lower left). Across the top is the East River divided by the northerly half of Welfare Island. Beyond in the Manhattan shore lying between the Queensboro Bridge and Carl Schurz Park. A portion of Wards Island appears in the upper right corner.

About 1929

Ewing Galloway
title: Queens: Long Island City - Astoria - General view.

text:
View of the northern end of Welfare Island, as seen from East End Ave.,
Manhattan, looking east into Long Island.

About 1930.

Wurts Brothers.
title: Manhattan: Welfare Island.

text:
View of northern tip of Welfare Island, looking north east from No. 25 East End Ave., Manhattan, into Astoria L.I. Hell Gate Bridge may also be seen in the background.

About 1930.

Wurts Brothers.
title: Islands - Welfare Island.

text:
(1)
Welfare Island, the eastern shore of its southern half, in the East River.  Also shown, across the island is the skyline of Midtown Manhattan.  The point of vantage is the foot of Harris Ave., Long Island City.

November 6, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date. The same vantage point as in view 1.

June 24, 1932.
P.L. Sperr.

(3)

The same, at a still later date, as seen from the Queensborough Bridge.

March 5, 1933.
P.L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Welfare Island - [Midtown Manhattan skyline.]

title: Islands - Welfare Island - [Midtown Manhattan skyline.]

text:
Welfare Island: The north end of the island, showing some of the hospital buildings. View 1 is from about East 65th street, Manhattan, and shows the island chapels.

View 3 shows the pier and a new hospital under construction, Shown, too, is the Queensboro Bridge.

View 1: George L. Balgue
August, 1930

Views 2,3: P. L. Sperr

View 2: August 3, 1938
View 3: July 1, 1937
title: Islands - Welfare Island - City Hospital.

text:

title: Islands - Welfare Island - City Hospital.

text:
Air view of Welfare Island's prison recreation yard; showing a race riot; resulting in many serious injuries, at its height. Riots of this nature are unusual in the prison.

January 14, 1932.

International News Photos.
title: Manhattan: Welfare Island - [Aerial view.]

text:
(1) and (2)
Welfare Island: A view of the northern part as seen from the Queensboro Bridge and viewing northward, showing the East River on both sides with Manhattan on the left and Astoria (Queens) on the right. In the background appears the Hell Gate (Railroad) Bridge. This is a set of 2 views.

April 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The new Hospital that was recently constructed in the foreground of the preceding views. The photographer is viewing northeastward from a point under the Queensboro Bridge.

July 1, 1937.

P.L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Welfare Island.

Welfare Island: A view of the western bank of the northern half of the Island as seen from the west channel of the East River. In the background appears the Triborough and the Hellgate Bridges.

A detail of same, showing the ferry boat "Welfare" off Welfare Island Landing.

July 10, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A cleared area, slightly north of view 2 and showing where new construction will occur.

July 10, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Welfare Island.

text:
(1)
Welfare Island: A view of the western bank of the northern half of the Island as seen from the west channel of the East River. In the background appears the Triborough and the Hellgate Bridges.

July 10, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A detail of same, showing the ferry boat "Welfare" off Welfare Island Landing.

July 10, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A cleared area, slightly north of view 2 and showing where new construction will occur.

July 10, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Welfare Island.

text:
Welfare Island: A view southward on the East River (west channel) showing the northern half of same. Manhattan is 'on the right and connects with Long Island City via the Queensborough Bridge. View No. 2, of this set is slightly southward.

July 10, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
